H0.text: who abandoned traditional harmony and created the twelve-tone system for composition. Alban Berg

H1.text: who abandoned traditional harmony and created the twelve-tone system for composition. Anton Webern

H2.text: who abandoned traditional harmony and created the twelve-tone system for composition. Igor Stravinsky

H3.text: who abandoned traditional harmony and created the twelve-tone system for composition. Arnold Schoenberg

A4.text: Schoenberg arrived at his 'method of composing with twelve tones which are related only with one another'.

A5.text: Later, Schoenberg was to develop the most influential version of the dodecaphonic (also known as twelve-tone) method of composition.
